caption:
This photograph features a sweeping landscape showcasing a verdant valley and rolling hills. The image appears to be taken from a high vantage point, looking down into a valley predominantly covered in lush green woodland with sporadic patches of grass and shrubbery. Toward the bottom of the image, the focus of the landscape shifts to a series of roads winding through the hills; one of the roads leads to a small cluster of buildings with red roofs, possibly a residential or farm area.

In the middle distance, the terrain continues to undulate, presenting more hills that gradually become faint in the hazy atmosphere, suggesting either distance or a slight fog. The sky, occupying the uppermost section of the composition, is clear and imbued with a pale blue tone, which contrasts subtly with the rich green hues of the vegetation. There are no visible people or animals in this serene natural setting, giving the image a sense of quiet solitude. The overall atmosphere conveys a tranquil, rural landscape.
title: View of the santa monica mountains along mulholland drive near Malibu, California, which is located on the northwestern edge of Los Angeles.  The mountains contain the last semi-Wilderness in Los Angeles county.  Some 84 percent of the state's residents live within 30 miles of the coast, and this concentration has resulted in increased land use pressure.  Several commissions have been authorized by the legislature to restrict development along the state's shoreline
